RESOLVED_ENTITIES.this circuit: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.this case: United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.this Court: United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal court reviewing the case and providing jury instructions on the importance of reaching a verdict, emphasizing individual conscientious conviction in deliberations, with prior decisions upholding the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Maria De Jesus Garcia: trial where the jury was instructed on the importance of reaching a verdict and the potential consequences of not doing so, case involving a heavily loaded truck with fogged windows, also involves the issue of probable cause to search an automobile based on trustworthy facts and circumstances within the officer's personal knowledge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where the court cases are being held
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pena-Cantu: court case reference where the Allen charge was deemed permissible
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Pacheco: court case reference that affirmed the use of the modified Allen charge
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States v. Orona-Sanchez: court case reference that upheld the use of the modified Allen charge
